today_in_history_posts.title: CoinPool, exploring generic payment pools for Fun and Privacy
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Gleb Naumenko and a collaborator aim to improve Bitcoin privacy, focusing on second-layer protocol issues.
- CoinPool is introduced as a low-latency solution to enhance on-chain privacy without the drawbacks of CoinJoins.
- It offers scalability and privacy benefits by reducing linkability and on-chain transactions, despite deployment challenges.

today_in_history_posts.title: Disclosure of a fee blackmail attack that can make a victim loose almost all funds of a non Wumbo channel and potential fixes
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A blackmail attack on the Lightning Network using HTLCs was discovered in July 2019.
- This attack could lead attackers to steal funds by overloading a channel with HTLCs during fee spikes.
- Potential mitigations include lowered HTLC limits and patches by Lightning Network implementations like c-lightning.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's scalability aims for 50,000 off-chain entities to support 1 billion weekly users.
- High transaction costs advocate for semi-trusted, interconnected off-chain services for efficiency and security.
- Solutions include Utreexo for UTXO optimization and a focus on Layer 2 protocols for scalability and security.
